urls.title: Moonlighting
urls.description: Tales and misadventures of a working life with eelsTales and misadventures of a working life with eelsIn spring 1973, Michael Brown, a young freelance travel writer, took a phone call from a friend: 'Why don't you come down to Somerset and see these things called elvers - they migrate up river at night on the high tide

text:
Eels start their lives in the Sargasso Sea near the Caribbean, the European eel species travels across the Atlantic to #freshwater habitats (3,500km). They're now arriving to Norfolk, Suffolk and Essex
